attributes.comment:
The fee request is not reasonable unless the Fingerprinting and I-171H dates are
synchronized to expire on the same date and the validity date is updated from 18
to 24 months. There are long delays over 3 months now in waiting for the I-171H
to be approved. During this time, your fingerprints are aging. Most families
within just a few months have to begin the process again since their
fingerprints will soon expire and of course they will then pay the fees again.

This could be solved by fixing the process so that the fingerprints expire on
the same date as the approval. International adoptions are taking longer
especially in China and a 24 month expiration would keep families from clogging
the system with more paper and paying a second fee. This is supposed to be a
service we are paying for and not a revenue generation program.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Michael W. Perry
